TopicTitle: How can I get my kethane miner to the Mun?

Articles.Content:
So I have this miner and it isn't even 8 tons but I can not for the life of me figure out how to get it to the Mun. The farthest I have gotten is an orbit of 100k around Kerbin. I am still fairly new to this game so if this is a dumb question I apologize.

Here is the miner:

Here is the miner and launcher:

The launcher has three stages.

I tried adding SS boosters to the base of the rocket but it caused the center of lift to go to one side (not sure why cause I put them on symmetrically) making it too hard for my poor piloting skills to handle. I have tried different fuel tank combinations but that didn't help much either.

Any ideas for what I can try?

Craft File: http://www./download/33z7li7qfll1m2z/Kethane_minerwithlauncher_4.craft

I am using the kethane mod, mechjeb and modular multi wheels. Here is the wheels mod: http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/modular-multiwheels-and-omniwheels-v0-6-tt-plugin-for-ksp-0-20-and-0-19/

The landing legs a separately controlled so I am going to retract 3 of the legs and let it fall over on the wheels. I tried it on the launch pad and it seems to work pretty good. That was the only way I could think of landing it so if you have a better idea and would like to share that would be awesome.

Edited August 27, 2013 by sch518

Post the craft file and ill have a look when i get home. Also, any addons u have used exept kethane?

Will be home in a hour or so.

Awesome thanks. Here is the craft file.

http://www./download/33z7li7qfll1m2z/Kethane_minerwithlauncher_4.craft

Wasn't really sure how to do this so I just put it on mediafire, hope that is okay. I am using the kethane mod, mechjeb and modular multi wheels. Here is the multiwheels link:

http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/modular-multiwheels-and-omniwheels-v0-6-tt-plugin-for-ksp-0-20-and-0-19/
Also now, just noticed, how are you gonna land it? "crash" down the rocket on the surface?
Add Jetissonable counterweights on the side of your miner to balance against the wheels. I used to do that with manned landers that bring rovers with them.

The landing legs are controlled separately so i was going to land then retract 3 of them to let it fall onto the wheels. I tried it on the launch pad and it seemed to work okay. This was the only way I could think to land it so if you have a better way and would like to tell me that would be great too.
